{"step_by_step_thinking": "Embrasure types are classified based on the recession of the interdental papilla. Type I embrasure is characterized by no loss of interdental papilla. Type II embrasure is characterized by a slight to moderate recession of interdental papilla. Type III embrasure is characterized by severe recession or complete loss of interdental papilla. Type IV is not a recognized type of embrasure.", "answer_choice": "B"}
